messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] parentalrights.org?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Unfortunately some people are so fearful and feel so powerless they re afraid not to believe. HSLDA is good at scaring people into giving them money. Joyce
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 29, 2008, at 5:01 PM, Lyla Wolfenstein wrote:

> the stories of removals sound so far fetched they are hardto
> believe....

Unfortunately some people are so fearful and feel so powerless
they're afraid not to believe.

HSLDA is good at scaring people into giving them money.

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] parentalrights.org?
messages.msgSnippet: ... Here s what I sent to unschoolingbasics in case anyone here is seeing worth in the site: Three clicks and I m looking at Michael Farris.
messages.messageBody:
On Dec 29, 2008, at 4:35 PM, Nicole Willoughby wrote:

> I'm just wondering if anyone had more info good or bad about this
> site, group ?
> From the little exerpts what they are trying to accomplish sounds
> good but for some reason my is this bullshit ? radar keeps going off.
>
> http://www.parentalrights.org/learn/the-attack-on-parental-rights

Here's what I sent to unschoolingbasics in case anyone here is seeing
worth in the site:

Three clicks and I'm looking at Michael Farris.

http://www.parentalrights.org/about/board-of-directors

I had a sneaking suspicion that site would lead to a fundamentalist
Christian connection. Michael Farris and company are big against the
UN Convention on the Rights of Children.

Here's some links I sent to someone last time Michael Farris's name
came up:


> He and the pillars are responsible for crushing the livelihood of
> the unschooling mother who ran Gentle Spirit magazine.
>
> A report is here:
> http://www.homeedmag.com/seelhoffvs.welch/news.html
>
> Her reference to her court case against them is here (she won):
> http://wahomeednet.homestead.com/lawsuit.html
>
> Jesus I believe would be appalled at the behavior done in his name.
> Definitely not WWJD.
>
> And that's just on a personal level. Reading extensively about
> HSLDA is a good idea:
>
> A very good article in Salon Magazine:
> http://archive.salon.com/mwt/feature/2000/10/02/
> homeschooling_battle/index.html
>
> And a well organized collection of information at:
> http://hsislegal.com/whoishslda.asp
>
> This is old and tough going but nonetheless eye opening:
> http://homeedmag.com/INF/FREE/hsinfo_far1.html
>
> Yes, a lot of it is old. HSLDA and Michael Farris have gotten a lot
> more savvy about how they go about business. And HSLDA is
> fortunately no longer an exclusive storehouse of information on
> homeschooling so people are more likely to go to other resources
> than complain about HSLDA now.
>
> But better ability to spin their current actions doesn't change
> past behavior and the choices they consciously made as
> representatives of Christ.
>


Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] parentalrights.org?
messages.msgSnippet: 1. Your bullshit radar is functioning well. 2. Substitute property for parental and see how ideas play. Might be useful to play follow the money  and
messages.messageBody:
1. Your bullshit radar is functioning well.
2. Substitute "property" for "parental" and see how ideas play.

Might be useful to play "follow the money" and first trail to follow might
be path utilized by followers of "firstest and bestest solution is amend the
constitution".

vicki

On Mon, Dec 29, 2008 at 3:35 PM, Nicole Willoughby <
cncnawilloughby@...> wrote:

> I'm just wondering if anyone had more info good or bad about this site,
> group ?
> From the little exerpts what they are trying to accomplish sounds good but
> for some reason my is this bullshit ? radar keeps going off.
>
> http://www.parentalrights.org/learn/the-attack-on-parental-rights
>
> Nicole
>
> Don't worry that children never listen to you : worry that they are always
> watching you--Robert Fulghum
>
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
>
>
>


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
